docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 The Federal Trade Commission proposed today a nationwide rule permitting price advertising of eyeglasses, charging that existing prohibitions keep prices high and prevent the poor from getting glasses.

headline.main: F.T.C. Seeks to End Ban On Eyeglass Price Ads

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 The Federal Trade Commission proposed today a nationwide rule permitting price advertising of eyeglasses, charging that existing prohibitions keep prices high and prevent the poor from getting glasses.

byline.original: By HAROLD M. SCHMECK Jr. Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Ten states have joined with the Natural Resources Defense Council and two other private groups in a petition urging that fluorocarbon aerosol propellants be banned as a threat to public health because of their suspected effect on the atmosphere's protective layer of ozone.

headline.main: 10 STATES URGING ACTION ON OZONE; Seek Ban on Fluorocarbon Aerosol Propellants by the U.S. Safety Commission
